data.title: Annette on the Big Screen & In Our Hearts

data.text:
The Annette Biography

VISIT THE ANNETTE DISCOGRAPHY AND MOUSEKETEER STORY (EARLIER POST – CLICK HERE)

Just finished reading Annette Funicello’s autobiography, “A Dream Is A Wish Your Heart Makes” by Patricia Romanowski …. a fun read but sad.

Unlike so many other children who pursued careers in the entertainment would, the Funicello family did not journey to southern California to find fame for their daughter. In fact, Annette had no intention of becoming a performer. It was only her very casual participation in a school talent show which just happened to have sitting in the audience one Walter Elias Disney who was there on the invitation of a friend with a child in the presentation.

A few days later the phone would ring at the Funicello household. Disney was calling regarding the darling 12-year old girl who captured his attention performing a ballerina-tap combination dance. An audition was offered for an new idea Walt had for a TV program which would feature little ‘mouseketeers’.

Annette’s mother was not excited about the prospect of a tryout. She misunderstood Walt thinking he had offered a role for Annette as a musketeer!

Well, mom relented, Annette attended the audition – and a star was born. Disney was looking for 24 children – preferably with no or little entertaining experience for his idea – And as it turned out, little Annette would be the 24th and final pick for a group of 24 youngsters to become the famous Mouseketeers!

The 24 were assigned to one of three groupings, Red team – White team and Blue team with the Red team being the Mouseketeer primary team of eight with Annette joined by Sharon Baird, Darlene Gillespie, Bobby Burgess, Lonnie Burr, Tommy Cole, Karen Pendleton, and Cubby O’Brien (and occasionally a few others).

Annette’s Battle with MS – Farewell to a Nation’s Sweetheart…

She undertook this biography with the express intention of speaking frankly about her struggle with multiple sclerosis. Toward the end of the book Annette goes into much detail relating her initial symptoms and diagnoses. Most interesting for me was her detailed explanation of how MS occurs and how unpredictable it is.

I learned that by itself, unlike Alzheimer’s, MS is not fatal. Other conditions developed perhaps assisted by the presence of the disease but every case is so very different. Symptoms can develop, worsen, disappear and return or never return.

Annette came from the east coast with her parents to California at a very early age when she was only four. Her mother and father had no idea of where they would live – where he would find work and what the future held for them. They ended up in Encino in a modest home. Her father was great with automobiles and landed a job as a mechanic.

Visit this Annette with the Mouseketeers page which I published some time ago – Click on the image below:

I decided to cover the motion pictures that Annette appeared in. She loved working with the casts of these movies and formed life-long friendships with many of the actors/musicians, especially Frankie Avalon. When she and Frankie were touring together in those later years Annette decided to finally tell Frankie about her illness which she had held back from her friends.

To her astonishment Frankie already knew. Her second husband – Glen Holt – had secretly confided her condition prior to their tour in order that Frankie could watch over her more closely – make certain that she was in stable situations (such as not near the edge of the stage) due to her imbalance which was worsening. Annette was furious at both Glen and Frankie initially but then quickly came to the realization that they both must have cared about her so much.

Annette was diagnosed in 1987, wrote her biography in 1994 – lost her ability to walk in 2004, could no longer speak by 2009 and in a very sad condition – bedridden and fed by tube, passed away on April 8th, 2013 – hospitalized – She was 70 years-old. Her family and her life-long friend, Shelley Fabares – were with her at the moment of her passing

Annette received the “Disney Legend Award” in 1992 and received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in September of 1993.

The Filmography of Annette Funicello & Promotion Scrap Book

(The scrap book photos from the Facebook page follow the motion picture listings)

The Shaggy Dog – 1959

Cast included Annette, Fred MacMurray, Tommy Kirk and Tim Considine & Songs by Roberta Shore – Kevin Corcoran (Moochie) and others

LP – Disneyland 1044 – The Shaggy Dog – 1959

Babes In Toyland – 1961

The cast included Annette, Ray Bolger, Tommy Sands, Ed Wynn, Tommy Kirk and others

LP – Buena Vista 4022 – Babes In Toyland – Number 57 LP Charts – 19 Weeks on Charts – December, 1961

45’s Disney Children Series

Beach Party – Beach Party – June, 1963

Cast included Annette, Bob Cummings, Frankie Avalon, Morey Amsterdam, Dick Dale, Vincent Price, Roger Christian, Gary Usher and many more

At Walk Disney’s insistence Annette would not don bikini’s in Disney Films although it was approved for other ‘beach/surf” girls appearing in the films.

Les Baxter composed much of the soundtrack and Gary Usher along with Roger Christian penned three of the songs including “Swingin’ & Surfin'”, “Secret Surfing Spot” which were performed in the film by Dick Dale and the Del Tones.

LP – Buena Vista 3316 – Annette’s Beach Party – June, 1963

The Misadventures Of Merlin Jones – 1964

Cast included Annette, Tommy Kirk and others – There was no musical soundtrack

45 – Buena Vista 431 – Annette with the Wellingtons and Tommy Kirk – Merlin Jones b/w The Scrambled Egghead – March, 1964

45 – Buena Vista 431 – Annette with the Wellingtons – Merlin Jones b/w The Scrambled Egghead – March, 1964

45 – Buena Vista 475 – Annette with the Wellingtons – Merlin Jones – 1969

Reissue

Muscle Beach Party – 1964

The cast included Annette along with Frankie Avalon, Don Rickles, Dick Dale, Donna Loren, Buddy Hackett, Peter Lorre and more – This LP was loaded with hot rod songs composed by Gary Usher and Roger Christian

“Happy Street” by Stevie Wonder was included in the film but not on the Disney LP – It did appear on Stevie’s “At the Beach LP.

LP – Vista Buena 3314 – Annette’s Muscle Beach Party – April, 1964

45 – Challenge – Donna Loren – Muscle Bustle b/w How Can I Face the World – March, 1964

45 – American International – Special Promo from the film

45 – Buena Vista – Annette – Custom City b/w Rebel Rider – June, 1964

45 – Tamla 54103 – Stevie Wonder – Happy Street – September. 1964

45 – Buena Vista 475 – Annette with the Wellingtons – Merlin Jones – 1969

Bikini Beach – September, 1964

Cast included Annette, Frankie Avalon, Keenan Wynn, Don Rickles. singers Donna Loren, Candy Johnson, and Stevie Wonder and also Boris Karloff – The Pyramids played on a couple of tracks and backed up Stevie Wonder on “Happy Feeling”.

LP – Buena Vista 3324 – Annette at Bikini Beach -September, 1964

45 – Buena Vista 436 – Annette – Bikini Beach Party b/w The Clyde – August, 1964

45 – Buena Vista 437 – Annette – The Clyde b/w The Wah Watusi – September, 1964

LP – Canjo 1002 – Candy Johnson & Her Exciters – The Candy Johnson Show at Bikini Beach –

Candy fronted this group which included Don Hardgrove (later Hargrove), Bobby Fry, Jack Merrill, Jim Rector and Larry Ogden – She started off as a dancer and then was invited to join the Exciters as their lead singer.

Candy Johnson and the Exciters performed “Gotcha Where I Wantcha” in the film

45 – Sundazed 111 – The Pyramids – Biking Drag – 2000

LP CD – Varese Sarabande 302 – Annette, Frankie Avalon & Others – Summer Beach Party – 2006

Pajama Party – October, 1964

The cast included Annette, Tommy Kirk, Donna Loren, Dorothy Kilgallen, Candy Johnson, Frankie Avalon and future recording star Toni Basil.

LP Buena Vista 3325 – Annette’s Pajama Party – October, 1964

Beach Blanket Bingo – 1965

The cast included Annette along with Frankie Avalon, Buster Keaton, Paul Lynde, Don Rickles and others

This would be Frankie Avalon’s final beach movie

LP – Capitol 2323 – Donna Loren – Beach Blanket Bingo – 1965

45 – Capitol 5409 – Donna Loren – New Love – April, 1965

LP CD – La La Land 1142 – Les Baxter – Beach Blanket Bingo Movie Score

The Monkey’s Uncle – 1965

Cast included Annette this time without Frankie Avalon – She was joined by long time fiend Tommy Kirk – cameo appearances were made by the five Beach Boys playing themselves and singing with Annette.

Say what you will, the movie earned over 4 million dollars – not bad for that genre that far back in time

45 – Buena Vista 440 – Annette – The Monkey’s Uncle b/w How Will I Know My Love – February, 1965

Ski Party – 1965

Cast members included Annette, Frankie Avalon, Dwayne Hickman, Lesley Gore, James Brown and the Hondells and others

45 – Mercury 72443 – Sunshine, Lollipops and Rainbows – Number 13 Hot 100 – May, 1965

From the soundtrack and co-composed by Marvin Hamlisch

How To Stuff a Wild Bikini – 1965

The cast included Annette along with Dwayne Hickman, the Kingsmen, Mickey Rooney, Frankie Avalon and Elizabeth Montgomery from “Bewitched” among many others.

LP – Wand 671 – Move Cast including the Kingsmen – September, 1965

45 – Wand 189 – The Kingsmen – Give Her Lovin’ – July, 1965

Performed in the motion picture by the Kingsmen

Dr, Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine – 1965

The cast included Annette along with Frankie Avalon, Vincent Price, and Dwayne Hickman among others.

45 – American International 3335 – The Supremes – Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine – Promo

This record was released only as a one-side promotional record

Fireball 500 – 1966

Cast included Annette along with Frankie Avalon, Fabian and sports announcer Vincent Scully among others. The follow up movie would be titled “Thunder Alley”.

Thunder Alley – 1967

Cast included Annette along with Fabian, Diane McBain and others.

45 – Sidewalk 913 – Band Without a Name – Theme From Thunder Alley – March, 1967

This group would become American Revolution which included Daniel Derda, Eddie Haddad, John Keith and Richard Barcellona

Head – 1968

Head was a strange adventure for Annette – In her book she states that even after it was completed she really couldn’t figure out what it was about …. if anything. He beach movie days were behind her now and this one only offered her a cameo role.

The cast included Annette along with the members of the Monkees and some curious additions of Frank Zappa, Teri Garr, and boxer Sonny Liston – Jack Nicholson had a part as did Dennis Hopper, Toni Basil again as a dancer and finally football player Ray Nitschke.

LP – Colgems 5008 – Head – Number 45 LP Charts – December, 1968

45 – Colgems 1031 – The Monkees – The Porpoise Song – Number 68 Hot 100 b/w As We Go Along – October, 1968

From the soundtrack

Back To the Beach – 1987

Annette had to mull over the idea to do a ‘beach reunion’ film. But after much discussion, she and Frankie Avalon took on the project as producers.

The cast was an interesting mix of talent and included Annette and Frankie of course joined by Dick Dale once again and then a fun roster with Connie Stevens, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Bob Denver, Edd Byrnes, Tony Down, Jerry Mathers, Don Adams, Barbara Billingsley, David Bowie and Paul Reubens aka Pee-wee Herman! Dave Edmunds, Eddie Money and Private Domain all contributed songs for the film.

LP – Columbia 40892 – Back to the Beach – Number 188 LP Charts – 1987

45 – Columbia 7301 – Pee-Wee Herman – Surfin Bird – 1987

45 – Columbia 7340 – Stevie Ray Vaughan and Dick Dale – Pipeline – 1987

Annette Along the Way
